intro: Townsendia annua, commonly known as annual Townsend's gayfeather, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has a short life cycle, completing its growth and reproduction within a single growing season. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
